turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: The plans for use of the maze were not disclosed to me.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I decided it this morning.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Then you must allow me to stay close to you so that --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I am King, d'Artagnan.  I will change my mind as I wish, and I will enjoy my banquet as I wish!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: But I deployed the Royal Guards according to your previous --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Let us play a game, d'Artagnan, let us pretend I am King and you are Captain of my Musketeers.  Let us behave as if my wish is law.  And my wish is to enjoy this party!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Aaa!  D'Artagnan!  These passages were constructed for the King's security, not so you could step from my father's portrait and startle me to death!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: It is for your security that I have come, your Majesty -- for the security of your honor.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I already know about the riots, d'Artagnan, I heard them out there whispering.  Some fool gave the order to distribute rotten food.  I will deal with it tomorrow.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Then there is one more thing, of an even more personal nature.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: A personal nature?

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Mademoiselle Michelle Beaufort.  She is betrothed to Raoul, the son of Athos the Musketeer, who has served France through many tribulations.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Betrothed?  I think not.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: In his mind, anyway, and soon enough in hers.  She had written him many letters of love.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Miss Beaufort has accepted our invitation.  By this we can only suppose that she wishes to come -- as we wish her to be here.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Your Majesty has had many women --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That is my desire, and my desire is what should concern you, not the sentiments of some commoner!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: It is not Raoul's heart alone that concerns me.  It is yours.  I know you find women compliant -- especially the poorer ones like Michelle.  But do they love you?  Do you love them?  What about a queen to love?  A son of your own?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What quaint notions, d'Artagnan! But they contradict my father, who picked his queen when he was old, and only then to bear me.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: There is more to love than he knew, or that you know.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You dare criticize my father?!  Or lecture me?!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Not criticize -- plead.  Love.  Love your people, and you will not bear to see them hungry.  Love women, and they will love you.  Love yourself, and --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That is enough!  You are a good servant, d'Artagnan, but you forget your place!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: At least help Raoul.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Silence!  I order you!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Order Fromberge to keep him in safety!  It is the least you can do, to protect your own honor!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I will consider it.  Now leave me.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Thank you, your Majesty.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I just left the garden, it was empty.  What did you see?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: It... was nothing.  A nightmare, nothing more.  Go away, I --

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Your Majesty.  This ball, with an open invitation to the nobility of Paris -- we have no way of checking --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You will protect me as you always have, d'Artagnan.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Your Majesty...?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: ... tired.  Must... lie down.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I want all these passages sealed! Another stupid idea of my father's! Seal them all, every one!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: It shall be done, your Majesty.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Even the bedchamber passages!  Let none remain!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Yes, your Majesty.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I was told this impostor was dead!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: ... You knew you had a double?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: He is my brother.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I -- I thought he was but... an impostor who resembled --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: My twin.  Which has kept him alive. Until now.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Your Majesty... This man before you... He is royal blood, the same as you.  To spill it is the one thing even you cannot do.  It is against the laws of God, and of France.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Get out of my way.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Not once have I ever asked anything for myself.  I ask now.  Forgive this man, this prisoner... your brother.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Forgive?!

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Aramis, Porthos and Athos too.  I know what they have done was a threat against you -- and yet that threat has been removed, with no harm coming to your Majesty.  If their passions were in error, their spirits have ever been noble. Forgive them.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: They have plotted against me!  Me! The embodiment of God's will!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Where is Michelle?

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: There.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: Continue.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Sire, we have an emergency -- of security.  I must ask you to accompany me.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: ... The ball... Continue.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: I must insist, Sire.

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: Wait.  Bargain me to Louis, for all your lives.  You have done your best.  Let me go, and let all of you find peace.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: No.  Even if I could give up my friends, I could never give up my son.

turns.speaker: D'ARTAGNAN
turns.text: Phillippe!

turns.speaker: PHILLIPPE
turns.text: I am unhurt --

turns.speaker: KEEPER
turns.text: You dead yet?

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: No, Keeper.

turns.speaker: KEEPER
turns.text: Food, moron.

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: Thank you, Keeper.

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: What number did you tear out?

turns.speaker: KEEPER
turns.text: Eh?

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: What number, on the first page?

turns.speaker: KEEPER
turns.text: ... Two-thirty-seven.

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: Two-thirty-seven:  "... And the descendants of Japeth are these: Obediah, Zebulon, Hezekiah..."

turns.speaker: KEEPER
turns.text: You've... memorized...?

turns.speaker: MAN IN THE IRON MASK
turns.text: What was the end page?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: I would not have disturbed you, Majesty, but you ordered me to keep you informed --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Yes, yes, go on.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Athos, the former Musketeer, has just fought with several of your guard, at the Musketeers' Gate.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Did they kill him?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: No.  He cut an ear from one of the men, no one else was hurt.  Captain d'Artagnan allowed him to leave. Athos was upset about the death of his son, at the front.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Who was Athos seeking?  Tell me! Did he try to enter the palace?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: ... He did -- but Captain d'Artagnan blocked his way.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You may go, Lieutenant.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Do you want Athos arrested, your Majesty?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Not by you.  I will order d'Artagnan to do it.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Now.  Where is d'Artagnan?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Out directing the search for the traitors.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: When he returns, watch him.  When he leaves again, you tell me.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Cowards!  Twenty run from four?!

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: The corridor nullifies our number... And no one has stomach to fight the Captain.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Magnificent valor...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Shoot them!  Shoot them!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Riots?  My people live in the world's most beautiful city, their king has the grandest palaces on earth.  Why should they feel anything but pride and contentment?

turns.speaker: PIERRE
turns.text: Well yes, of course, Majesty, and I'm sure they are content... except that... well, they are starving.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Sometimes the poor do grow hungry. But why would they riot about it?

turns.speaker: PIERRE
turns.text: Majesty... We have more than enough food set aside for your birthday celebration next week.  If we distributed some of that, we would have time to gather more before --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Aramis!  I have been expecting you!  We are satisfied, that will do.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Ah yes, the riots.  We have food stocks on the wharves right now, no?

turns.speaker: PIERRE
turns.text: That food has spoiled.  That is why it was not shipped to the army.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Exactly why it should be given away.

turns.speaker: PIERRE
turns.text: What... an excellent idea, your Majesty!

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I would have said it was impossible, but I believe the excitement of the chase has made you even more beautiful.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Sire, I --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You blush!  You do not wish to be beautiful to your King?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Sire!  I -- How did you --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: How did I get in?  You're new here, and will soon learn many secrets. What is that?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: ... Nothing.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: A letter.  May I see?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: From Raoul.  He urges you to guard your honor -- as if it could be in any danger... from your king.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Raoul... is in love...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Enough of this, our dinner waits.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: The food doesn't please you?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: It's lovely.  It's just...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: This is more than you are used to. Your mother is a seamstress, your father is dead.  You have three younger sisters, two of whom suffer from consumption.  Don't look so surprised, Kings know such things.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: I... we are humble people...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Wait, no!  Do not be ashamed.  The straits of your family need not be permanent.  It is a simple matter to have them brought to one of my country estates, where they may have fine meals, and physicians to look after them.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: You would do that, your Majesty?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: My dear, I've already done it.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You are beautiful.  You know you are.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Sire, I --

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: If you don't want to be so appealing, why did you touch the rose to your skin?  Where was it? Here?

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Shall I leave?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: No, you may wait behind the screen.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Did you know... about Raoul?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I did not want to upset you.  It was tragic.  I did everything I could for him.  I ordered him positioned in a spot of complete safety, far from the fighting.  But he disregarded my wishes and charged into danger.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I will order a Mass for his soul. It will guarantee his place in Heaven.

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Oh Louis, Louis...

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: Raoul... Oh, Raoul...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Listen, my darling... Raoul was a... a good friend.  And now he is dead and that is very sad but --

turns.speaker: MICHELLE
turns.text: We'll burn in hell.  Both of us.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Captain Doyle?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What can I do for you?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Your department contacted our agency regarding information on Sarah Williams.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah - I heard - nothing came up.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: We did a little digging on Jim Trudell at Sergeant Zydowski's request. He's 31, no priors, and he's been working for the military for ten years.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: We ran the i.d.  I could have told you that.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I don't think you understand. I don't mean shuffling papers in an office, I mean Jim Trudell worked classified assignments, special forces...sabotage...until last year. He was brought up on charges of espionage, but the charges were later dropped, and he sprang the service.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah?..well what are you getting at? You saying he has an agenda down here?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Our agency monitors all threats very carefully, and there's good reason to believe Jim Trudell has the training, the connections, and the experience to present a clear threat to the public if he remains at large.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: If what you're saying is true, then why would he have killed two police officers? A man like that would want to lay low, if he was planning some kind of damn sabotage mission!

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: That's the point.  He slipped up, and he's desperate now.  And that means he's all the more dangerous.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: I'm sure if our departments cooperate we can find out the truth.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Cooperate?

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Every step of the way.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: If you guys want in, fine.  Just remember this is our jurisdiction.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Alright, we know who we're looking for.  Play it cool until the time is right to make a move.  Let's not pull any gangbusters shit or we'll lose him again.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: Or worse, we'll have a hostage situation on our hands.

turns.speaker: CRAIG
turns.text: You mind if I ride with you?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah, stick around, you might learn something.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: It's Marvosa -

turns.speaker: D.T.
turns.text: What do you need?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: The shit just hit the fan, brother. That bitch has a partner and he got away from me.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: He walked in on Fleming and took him out.

turns.speaker: D.T.
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: So what is they have enough to shut us down!

turns.speaker: D.T.
turns.text: You mean shut your ass down!

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: No I mean ours, motherfucker! If I go down everyone's going with me - you and your crew especially! You won't get protection, you won't get the trucks - nothing!

turns.speaker: D.T.
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Where are you?

turns.speaker: D.T.
turns.text: We're by Ozone...

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: You set to go -

turns.speaker: D.T.
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Alright, stay on the phone.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Bullshit...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Did you report it stolen?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: You can cut the shit, asshole--

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: we've got kidnapping, grand theft auto, burglary, and two counts of murder on you, and I'm gonna see to it personally that it sticks!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What the hell happened?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: He busted the back window with his feet, and fled on foot.  We pursued him into this warehouse - but he's - gone, south - maybe a couple of miles if he's fast -

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Why didn't you call for back-up! What were you thinking, Jesus!!!

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: It happened too fast.  He was in the back, quiet and calm and boom! He was out - and gone.  We...we fanned out...Stanton must have let his guard down!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I don't know how you're used to doing things, Marvosa, but it sounds like some damn sloppy work to me!

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Oh for Chrissakes it could have happened to anyone of--

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What the hell is this Marvosa!!

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: He must have got the keys... off Stanton.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Great. Well that changes a lot...

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: I'm going to look for him on my own. Fuck this.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: We're all gonna fan out!  C'mon, let's do a sweep of the alleys -

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Don't take any chances.  Call for back-up this time!

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Don't worry -

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Did you hit him?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I didn't hit shit!

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: What did the six-toes have to say?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Sarah Williams left the bar with Trudell on her own.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: So? Girls left bars with Ted Bundy too. It doesn't rule out foul play.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: But what was a hair dresser from Malibu doing 60 miles away in some dive bar?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: I don't know, shit.  Maybe she was looking for love...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Find out for me.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Fine...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Let's roll -

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Right behind you.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: If you can trail him to a remote area do it. We all want a piece of him but let's keep our heads and stay within the law - we got people everywhere out here.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: These crowds are going to make it a bitch!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I'm sure you can handle it.  Now I want to do an alley-to alley sweep beginning at the north and south ends from Marine to 30th.  Foot beat units continue on the boardwalk.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: I'll take the south end -

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Fine -

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Our getaway car.  You said a cell phone?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: When did you join the force?  You know, the police force, the place you work...

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Nineteen eighty four.  What fucking difference does it make?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Did you start out area six?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: So you must have known Fleming... and Stanton -

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Yeah I saw 'em around.  They worked vice.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Well don't you think that's odd?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: It's kind of a funny coincidence, isn't it?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Gotta come from somewhere...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Where do you come from, Marvosa?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Just wondering if maybe they had a thing going with this hooker, you know, some connection.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Hey what they did on their time was their business, you know?  I just want to catch this scumbag, wherever he is.

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: Outside hacker?  What the fuck are you talking about?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: That's got to our secret agent man! Do we have an address?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Something wrong with you Marvosa?

turns.speaker: MARVOSA
turns.text: It's just...catching up with me, you know?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Well why don't you sit this one and get some rest...you look like shit. CUT TO INT TUBBS' APARTMENT - NIGHT

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Alright, where is she?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: And who are you?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Who am I?  I'm gonna be your worst fucking nightmare until you start breaking it down for me.  You understand? Where did you get the car!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'm done talking until I get a lawyer.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Anyhow...	you wake up and she's gone. But--  --this is my favorite part--  she leaves you the keys to a brand new Beemer.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: She stole my car!!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: So...  to get the car back, you break into her house.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I didn't break in - the back door was open!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah, it was opened -  with a goddamn screwdriver!!!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I'll live...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: I tell you one thing Trudell - you'd make a hell of a cop...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It wasn't in the cards.

turns.speaker: LURCH
turns.text: The guy was looking for trouble, shoving people around, being an asshole...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: And he took a swing at you?

turns.speaker: LURCH
turns.text: Yeah...the guy was psycho - I was just tying to protect the girl...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Did he harm the girl?

turns.speaker: LURCH
turns.text: Hell, he probably raped her in the lot, dumped the body somewhere. That's what he was like - a real wacko.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Mm-hmm...that's not what the bartender told us.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Now you listen to me hay-seed! If you don't want to spend a year in jail for making a false report you'll start giving me straight answers, you got that!!

turns.speaker: LURCH
turns.text: Alright, alright!  We were just fucking with him..you know?

turns.speaker: LURCH
turns.text: I was just having a little fun -

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: And what did he do to the girl?

turns.speaker: LURCH
turns.text: Nothing!  He didn't do nothing!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Zydowski.  It's about time.

turns.speaker: ZYDOWSKI
turns.text: You won't like this.  I ran the prints from the house.  No police record on your suspect--at least not in our files. But there is a match on the girl.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: ZYDOWSKI
turns.text: Her prints belong to Stephanie Field, convicted for soliciting two years ago.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: What?  Wait a minute -

turns.speaker: ZYDOWSKI
turns.text: That's not all.  According to the computer - she died of a drug overdose last year.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: That's great Zydowski, you tech guys are really on the ball.  Harding - call the print lab at the FBI, run the prints through their library, see if it's less screwed-up than ours...

turns.speaker: ZYDOWSKI
turns.text: Did you read today's paper?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: No Zydowski I didn't read today's paper - it's just going to irritate the hell out of me.

turns.speaker: ZYDOWSKI
turns.text: Well read this -

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Something I don't already know?

turns.speaker: ZYDOWSKI
turns.text: Well it's just kind of a coincidence, isn't it?  Stanton and Fleming, both started in '83, both in area six...both in Vice?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Vice...you think they had something to do with this dead hooker?

turns.speaker: ZYDOWSKI
turns.text: Could explain why Fleming was there.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: And where the hell is Marvosa?

turns.speaker: ZYDOWSKI
turns.text: He said he was following up some lead.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Well let's get his ass to the garage!  Some lead...

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Captain there's someone here to see you - he's waiting in your office.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: I don't know - but he's from the FBI.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Where is he?!!

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: I lost him - I heard shots - that way!!

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Speak of the devil.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: They found the getaway Mercedes a parking garage north of Venice. It checks out.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Good! We'll get it to the nearest outlying station and hold it for prints - we're on our way -  You coming?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Captain?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: LAPD data center reports a breach on the system.  An outside hacker has accessed files on Detectives Fleming and Stanton...and yours too, Marvosa.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: So where are you from?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Up north.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Where up north?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Seattle.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: You got any family?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: You're the mysterious type, right?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Mind if I turn out the light?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: You know, you don't seem afraid of much either.  How do you know I'm not going to try to rape you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Figure you would have tried it already.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You always carry a gun with you?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Only on dates?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What's going on here?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: You'll find out - soon enough.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Why did you set me up?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I didn't.  I figured you leave it well enough alone.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well you figured wrong!  And now I'm public enemy number one.  You have an answer for that?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I had to get away!  My life was in danger!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Look what are you anyway? Some kind of spy?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: No.  A witness.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What exactly did you see?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Six months ago, a police lieutenant named Charles Fletcher was found dead in a hotel room - he blew his brains out - left no note, you may have heard of it...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No, but I'm listening.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I was there, and it was no suicide. He was killed by professionals.  I was in the bathroom when it happened.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Didn't these - professionals - figure he had a girl in the room?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Yeah...they did.  One girl...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: And what did you do?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I got out of there.	I just grabbed up my stuff, and then I found it.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Found what?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I had it all on tape...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What did you do then?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I didn't know what to do - but I knew I had something somebody would want.  That's where I met him - told him what I had.  The FBI set me up with a new place...but the cops found me somehow.  So I ran...and met you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What happened with the tape?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: I took it with me.  It's in a safe place.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So you know about Marvosa, and Stanton, and all of them.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: There's something I've been meaning to ask you, Stephanie.

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Where the hell is my car?

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Have you ever heard of the Live Oak River?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No -

turns.speaker: STEPHANIE
turns.text: Neither did I.  I'll make it up to you, I promise...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Jim Trudell!  Bravo company!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Tubbs, it's me.

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Well where are ya, what are ya, drunk?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No...I'm in some trouble...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Well...whatsamatter?  Run in with the law?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: You are drunk.  You know, it's been a long time and I'd love to catch up, but I really got to -

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Tubbs listen!  I don't know anywhere else to go!  I need your help!

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Just what did you get yourself into, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It's...it's a long story.  Can we meet somewhere?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Jesus, man...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Operator, I'd like to make a collect call - 213-467-0972...

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: This is Tubbs. Sorry I can't answer the phone, I'm out square dancing. Leave a message--

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Holy shit -

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Hello Tubbs.  Can I come in?

turns.speaker: TUBBS
turns.text: Yeah, c'mon in...you scared the hell out of me!
